intro: Oxymitra paucinervis, commonly known as the slender oxymitra, is a flowering plant species native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Araliaceae and is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves with few veins. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are clustered in umbels, typical of the Araliaceae family. Oxymitra paucinervis is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forests and rocky areas. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for studies on tropical plant morphology and ecology.
